company_context: Welcome to The Apache Software Foundation | Apache Software Foundation Introducing The ASF’s New Logo Read Now Toggle navigation Community Contributor Getting Started Becoming a Committer Code of Conduct Community Resources Community Over Code Events Projects Projects Incubator Projects Projects Directory Mailing Lists Report a Vulnerability The Apache Attic Downloads Distributions Releases Learn Blog How the ASF Works The Apache Way Legal & Trademark Licenses Glossary FAQ Resources & Tools Developer Information Wiki Issues Slack Self Serve Portal Infrastructure Infrastructure Status Infrastructure Statistics Whimsy Brand Guidelines Project Logos About About Our Sponsors Corporate Sponsorship Individual Supporters Leadership Members Diversity & Inclusion Newsroom Contact Sponsor Search Software For The Public Good ¶ The Apache® Software Foundation (ASF) provides software for the public good, guided by community over code. Like the enduring oak tree, our projects thrive through the contributions of thousands worldwide. See Projects Our Impact ¶ 290+ Open Source Projects 1300+ Software Releases 9800+ Committers 1140+ Members Our Open Source Projects ¶ The ASF is the home of the world’s most trusted open source projects in data, cloud, search, libraries, geospatial, IoT, and beyond. See All Projects Our Incubating Projects ¶ See All Incubating Projects Incubate a Project ¶ Give your project a neutral, trusted home where communities flourish — with the ASF’s expertise, tools, and support to help you succeed. Incubate Project Everyone is Welcome ¶ At The ASF, contribution is for everyone. Whether code, docs, or ideas — your +1 makes a difference. Come contribute and grow with us. New to The ASF? Start here Upcoming Events ¶ Flink Forward 2026 ¶ Shenzen, China ¶ July 11-12, 2026 Flink Forward is the streaming data event for the future, bringing communities together to learn, network, and share experiences and best practices in stream processing, real time analytics, event-driven applications, AI and real-time intelligence, and the management of mission-critical Flink deployments in production. See Event ❮ ❯ Thank You, Sponsors ¶ The ASF is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, supported by individual and corporate donors who believe in secure software for the public good and the power of community over code. See All Sponsors ASF Plus One ¶ Explore what’s new at The ASF — from project news to community voices, all in one place. conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Hi, my name is Alex and I'm reaching out from DeepData AI. I came across The Apache Software Foundation and was impressed by the work you're doing in open source projects. I wanted to introduce our data processing solution that helps organizations like yours streamline their data workflows and gain deeper insights. Can you tell me a bit about your current data processing challenges?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (sighs) Look, we're a non-profit organization focused on providing software for the public good. We don't really have the budget for fancy data processing solutions. Our community of contributors and committers are already doing a great job with our existing infrastructure. What makes you think we need something like DeepData AI?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I completely understand your concerns about budget, but I'd like to highlight that DeepData AI is designed to help organizations like yours optimize their data processing workflows, which can lead to significant cost savings in the long run. Our solution can also help you uncover new insights from your data, which can inform your project decisions and ultimately benefit the community. I'd love to schedule a demo to show you how DeepData AI can specifically address your data processing pain points. Would you be open to that?

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (skeptical) I'm not sure...we're already using a combination of open source tools to manage our data. I'm not convinced that a proprietary solution like DeepData AI would be a good fit for us. Plus, I'm concerned about vendor lock-in and the potential risks of relying on a third-party solution. How do you address those concerns?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: I completely understand your concerns about vendor lock-in and the importance of open source principles. I'd like to assure you that DeepData AI is designed to be highly interoperable with existing open source tools and frameworks. We also offer flexible deployment options, including on-premises and cloud-based deployments, to give you full control over your data. Additionally, our solution is built on top of open standards, which ensures that you can easily integrate it with your existing infrastructure. I'd be happy to provide more information on our architecture and deployment options if you're interested.

conversation.speaker: Buyer
conversation.message: (still skeptical) Okay, I'll listen...but you'll need to convince me that DeepData AI is worth considering. What specific benefits can you offer that our existing open source tools can't provide? And how do you plan to support our community-driven development model?

conversation.speaker: Seller
conversation.message: Absolutely. DeepData AI offers advanced data processing capabilities, such as real-time analytics and machine learning, that can help you gain deeper insights from your data. Our solution also provides a scalable and fault-tolerant architecture that can handle large volumes of data, which is particularly important for organizations like yours that rely on community contributions. In terms of supporting your community-driven development model, we offer a flexible API and a robust set of developer tools that allow your community to extend and customize our solution to meet their specific needs. I'd be happy to provide more information on our API and developer tools if you're interested.
